description:
Welcome Brussels Cassandra (C*) Users!

I'm proud to announce our very first meetup! Andras Szerdahelyi and IgnitionOne have graciously offered to host our first meetup and present how they've been using C* for their real time bidding needs.

Abstract

C* for the Real Time Web. Performance, throughput and high availability on C* 1.1 for Real Time Bidding.

Biography

Presentation by Andras Szerdahelyi, Solutions Architect at IgnitionOne NV. Andras is responsible for overseeing development of IgnitionOne's key marketing solutions that form the company's Digital Marketing Suite. Previously he has been employed in the financial sector and consulted various SMEs in the Central European region. His decade of industry experience comes from a wide variety of mostly web-focused software development roles. His hobbies include photography, arguing garbage collected platforms can be web-scale and geo-caching, possibly in reverse order. You can tweet him @pgn.

Be sure to come straight from the office, as food and beverage will be sponsored by DataStax.

I hope you're able to make it!
name: Cassandra at IgnitionOne | Realtime Web

description:
Hello Brussels C* Users,

For our next meetup, EURA NOVA has graciously offered to host at their offices and present on how they've used Apache Cassandra on a customer project at a multi-national telcom provider.

Sabri Skhiri, R&D Director at EURA NOVA, will present a 10 minute overview of a customer project in which they modified Apache Cassandra for implementing a distributed graph storage and a traversal engine for a multi-national telecom equipment provider. This framework is used today a foundation for a set of "social services" in the general sense of the term (Social network but also network of user/products, analytics, etc.) He will also quickly present some researches led about storage elasticity and how it can be quantified and formalized.

Ansar Rafique, Research Engineer at Cinnober Financial Technology will be presenting on Cassandra Data Model, Cassandra Internode Communication, Read and Write Request in Cassandra, Discuss some performance benchmark I did with Cassandra, and last but not least how to improve the performance in Cassandra.

Agenda

6:30pm - Food & Beverage Served

7:00pm - Presentation by Sabri Skhiri with Q&A

7:20pm - Presentation by Ansar Rafique with Q&A

8:00pm - Social

If you're interested in sharing with the group about your experiences with Cassandra, please email me directly at Brady@DataStax.com and I'd be happy to add you to the agenda.

Be sure to come straight from the office as food and beverage will be served, sponsored by DataStax.

I hope you're able to make it!
name: Cassandra at EURA NOVA
